Relations.title: Relations and Functions
Relations.summary: This chapter introduces sets, Cartesian products, relations, types of functions (one-one, onto, bijective), composition of functions, invertible functions, and binary operations. It lays the foundation for algebraic structures.
formulas: Cartesian product: A × B = {(a, b) | a ∈ A, b ∈ B}
Inverse function: f⁻¹(y) = x ⇔ f(x) = y
Binary operation: a * b ∈ S for all a, b ∈ S
derivations: Proof of equivalence relations (reflexive, symmetric, transitive)
Conditions for invertibility of a function
Proof of properties of composite functions
